Articles.Content:
Fully functional replica of the UR-700 - LK-700 lunar project by Chelomey's OKB-52

![db8164b2dd65.png](http://s47.radikal.ru/i117/1507/bb/db8164b2dd65.png)

[Download link](http://www./download/3j2odrkscin87ts/UR-700+-+LK-700.zip)

Notes:

Yes, it's half fueled. Only this way it gets proper TWR (it can't even takeoff with full tanks). If you want to just use the launcher, better build it from 2,5 m parts.

It's capable of reaching orbit without igniting the third stage. Kerbalized replicas of rocket often do that.

The lander (it's not fully fueled, either) works perfectly (it has some extra fuel on all the stages, but not too much)

Action groups: Abort - use the LES; 0 - drop LES and deploy the chutes

Video demonstration:

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/IN6YgBIFskw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Mission in pictures:

![ur_700___lk_700_by_alchemist_ch-d910nex.png](http://orig06.deviantart.net/aaaf/f/2015/193/7/a/ur_700___lk_700_by_alchemist_ch-d910nex.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-13T18:52:56Z" title="07/13/2015 06:52  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 13, 2015</time> by Alchemist**

did you add the crossfeed capability of the UR700 ? ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif) (the top of the side boosters were separate oxydizer and fuel tanks on the UR-700 concept - which were only feeding the 3 tanks making the core stage until separation - so those would remain topped off until sep ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)) - onion staging concept decades before space X ! ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

(yeh, i've been researching it a bit when i built my own in and older patch ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif))

**Edited <time datetime="2015-07-13T19:46:09Z" title="07/13/2015 07:46  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 13, 2015</time> by sgt\_flyer**

> 
> did you add the crossfeed capability of the UR700 ?

Yes, of course. Every side stack has 50% bonus fuel for the second stage. Although with it being halfway fueled (these engines are not powerful enough!) this is not so necessary. 

I like the rocket more with mainsails and 2.5 m parts, but then there aren't proper parts for the lander. Yeah, I also made this in earlier versions.
